availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Brown County, Ohio resident. Adams County Ohio, native. Daughter of Davis Badford and Mary A. Badford. Married to John W. Brookover. Mother of David B. Brookover, Richard Brookover, Mary E. Brookover, James C. Brookover, Samuel Brookover, and John F. Brookover. Resident of Brown County, Ohio in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Brown County, Huntington Township, p. 289A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Adams County, Sprigg Township, p. 82B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, County, Huntington Township, p. 94A-B.
Find A Grave, "John Brookover (1828-1884)," Memorial #9978604, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9978604 (accessed June 10, 2019).
